reviews: We loved this place, drinks were great, grounds are beautiful, fun activities with the amazing Ricky who will make anyone smile and have a great time, I need a full time Ricky at my house (lol) We did get sick off the food but hey it is Mexico, we never had tap water either. Luckily it only took us down for a day but we think it is the buffet food.

Incredible scenery, service, and amenities! This place is absolutely fanitastic. We came down for a family destination wedding and the ceremony was beautiful. The entire resort was amazing! The staff was very welcoming, helpful, and friendly.

It was my first time out of the country & the resort was gorgeous, the staff was so welcoming & kind! Especially the hype man as I call it, Ricky! He was amazing, energetic & fun to dance with! I absolutely loved the themed music nights especially when he was there! Thank you for the unforgettable experience, I highly recommend this resort! ☺️

I spend part of my vacations in Dreams Tulum and was such a good time. We want to come back soon. Also we did a trip around Yucatán and we went to chichen itza. The hotel was good, good food, but the most Incredible one was the entertainment the hotel has by the pool, Ricky was the best host ever. The beach was clear and the resort wasn’t too busy that is something that we like. Definitly the entertainment team with Ricky is the best!!!!!!!!

This trip is very cool but the design of the place is iffy. It’s has design flaws but it is good. Also Ricky is a super fun person and also an awesome party host guy. I played with him and had lots of fun and stuff. Overall it’s a very good trip and Ricky is very cool aswell

We had an awesome time at the resort for our friends wedding and we had a great time together. The staff was so lovely and the pool was such a fun time! Ricky was such an awesome performer and he made our stay so fun!

Everthing was awesome, ricky and his team is wonderfull really (victor, paula, andrea) our stay was thanks to them really amazing. The whole staff is wonderfull... The hotel is awesome too, reallybnice stay and anazing relax in the hotel. Staff is 5 star. Thank you

My friends and I came for a birthday weekend and had such a good time! Victor, Paola and Ricky made the trip! Victor was so personable and was so enthusiastic with all the activities like dancing, aquarobics, and break dancing! Ricky was bringing the energy and made sure everyone had fun every day and with each activity. Paola lead a great aquarobics class and fantastic with the traditional dancing.   We had such a fantastic, relaxing time. The food was incredible, accomodations were great and the pool and beach experience were exactly what we needed.

This hotel is simply not a Dream. First night we arrived, no hot water after a 14h flight. The reception simply asked us to wait without giving us any other solution. This happened twice during our stay. No A/C in the room for a night, impossible to sleep. Once again no solution provided and we were simply being asked to wait.   For the restaurants, half of them are closed during the evenings and with very restricted options, the food is not tasty at all, same food everyday. So basically we were paying for restaurants which were closed. Again no compensation offered. Also when we ordered at the Bordeaux restaurant the food in our plate was not matching the menu, when we asked our server why, he just replied that they run out of it.   Hotel seriously needs renovation as there was

The Hotel was probably 5 star 20 years ago. It's max 3 1/2 at this point in its lifespan. There are minimal amenities and activities available directly on the resort due to the ocean reef being close proximity...so most activities are coordinated with other hotels. Food was exceptionally average at best and rooms need updating.

Great resort friendly staff, not enough food options. Wish the Mexican food was actually Mexican food. The music by the pool was so low, wish I would have brought my own speaker. Wish they would make it known of events via flyers every day

The only real bad on this vacation is not staying longer and the fact any other hotel seems mediocre. Given more time, we would have experienced most if not everything the resort had to offer. We definitely will book another Dreams resort again in Mexico or another country that has a Dreams.

I went to Dream Tulum for my best friend's wedding. Overall the resort is fine. The F&B options are ok though they should have the better restaurants open every night vs. just the high volume nights. The staff is quite friendly. The vacation club presentation is not worth the resort money they give you to sit through thee presentation. I understand it's a 90 minute sales pitch that I got resort cash for sitting through but the sales folks are relentless. I sat through 4 different sales folks pitching me different options and was there far longer than 90 minutes. My guestroom keys stopped working on two different days, one of which was the same day they walked another couple into my guestroom while I was trying to take a nap. My hot water did not work until the 4th day of my 5

We had 5 nights and we’re so sad leaving, the hotel we moved to was awful for many reasons so we returned for 5 more amazing nights Food: Choice’s across all of the restaurants was great, eating out for over 2 weeks is of course hard toward the end but from quality of food to service we had zero complaints Pool & Entertainment: We loved it all, choice, variation, fun. Entertainment team were amazing, pool party will be remembered by out daughter forever! Kids Club: the girls are simply amazing, they made our daughter feel so special, she joined activities we could observe but insisted we let her go to movie night alone and the kids pool area was great We had such a great time, thanks to everyone at the resort

We just had our wedding at Dreams Tulum and could not be ANY HAPPIER with our experience! Our Wedding Coordinator Marianna was absolutely amazing! Running the wedding she showed the skills of a seasoned Stafe manager running a Broadway play! We were thrilled she was gifted to us! Our server Erick at the wedding was also amazing! After the rain sent us indoors he made sure our guests were well taken care of!   Whether at the swim up bar amor the bar at the Preferred club,  Oscar served up delicious cocktails. I can’t speak highly enough of how wonderful Alma was at Himitsu! She kept a groom to be well taken care of! Speaking of Himitsu, our chef for the hi at hi, Camelo was a master of his craft!  Then there was the awesome hype man Ricky and his crew running live band karaoke!

We had a fantastic time at Dreams Tulum.  Great food, drinks, property,  service and staff.  Shout out to Luis from vip members services.  Victor, Paula & Ricky are the best.  We had a great time with all the entertainment they provided throughout the day.    Defi

Relabeled as Dreams but built as a Sunscape or lower category.  The buildings housing the rooms look like prison buildings.  The activities pool looks new and refreshing but the large pool appears to have been built in the 1950’s.  Big square pool which can only be entered or exited by very cumbersome ladders.   Very difficult for many travelers! The pool is not in good shape.  The pool furniture has been worn out for years.   The restaurants are very subpar with limited choices.  Generally the food is undesirable.  The only saving grace is the wonderful staff. They have much work to do in their restaurants!  In 7 days we never experienced an enjoyable meal.   The beach is covered by seaweed and entering the water you must wade through the dense seaweed floating in the water.

Victor’s entertainment is super fun, he is very attentive and nice, we had lots of fun both days we stayed at the pool.  Service in this location is a five star as well! Pool is very clean and fresh!!

Was our third time in Mexico last two stayed at the moon place then after long journey arrived at the baggage reclaim  to which they took a lifetime to recover our cases seeing their was only two other fights made no sense but it came clear when going though customs all they were after was what cigarettes you had so beware then the hotel. the staff round the pool bar were more interested in their phones 📞 food just ok no nuts and olives served with your drinks even in the preferred bar if you what 5 star ⭐️ go to the moon place

Ricky, Paola & Victor were amazing during our stay at Dreams. We attended a 'How to make quacamole' lesson, and I was surprised at how good both the class and the guacamole were. Ricky spoke in both Spanish and English which kept my attention. He was very amusing and the guacamole was delicious.  Paola & Victor were great with the swimming pool entertainment and there was lots of belly laughs along the way. Ricky, Paola and Victor are an asset to Dreams and are most definitely the dream team.

I had a bumpy start with the check in at the resort, but the resort has been able to accommodate my stay as much as possible. Shoutout to Angel from Preferred Club. Also shoutout to Francisco for being such a good sport with my friends. What made my stay worth while was the entertainment team; Ricky, Victor, and Paola. Their aquatic Zumba, aerobics, and volleyball were fun and entertaining. I wish they offered these classes multiple times in a day. I loved their themed nights such as Mexican night where they had traditional foods, games, and entertainment. The whole staff are very nice and respectful. Amstar helped booked our excursions and transportation at the resort lobby. I would come back here again.

Awesome resort and amazing hospitality. Great ocean views and great food. Everything you need is right here. Don’t go anywhere else stay here! The drinks are also made very quickly and the pool is excellent and there is a swim up bar. If you need help with anything go see my Friend Ricky for the best service/ advice.

Currently staying at Dreams Tulum. Ricky is fantastic! He made our trip a fantastic experience. If you have the pleasure of making it to Dreams. Look out for Ricky. He'll be everywhere. He knows all the best spots to go to on and off the resort. Ricky is awesome!

Food could have had better options. Food needed better quality. The employees were the best part of the whole trip. Ricky, Marco, Juan, epacito, they made sure we felt welcomed and involved in everything. If the food was better with the amazing staff this resort would be getting a 5.

We had a wonderful time at the resort. The level of service provided was of the highest standards. One of the key services to mention is the Explorer's Club. All the staff were warm and welcoming. They host different activities every day from camping to mini spa sessions for the children. You can drop your child off any time from 10am in the morning to 10pm at night. I cannot praise the staff enough. Mari, Vcine, Leslie, Pati, Vale and all the other staff were just great to the point where our little girl never wanted to leave. There is also a newly renovated mini kids water park inside the club. The Explorer's Club is a key facility for the resort and a must for families.  The restaurant staff at the World Cafe were also great. All the staff were hospitable and professional

For a group of couples and friends this was a great location.  Had a wonderful time thanks to the amazing entertainment team Ricky ❤️, Victor and Paola. There were latin parties, Zumba , dance classes almost every day which made our stay even more fun and  memorable 💃🏻 . Good service and Very friendly personnel. Multiple restaurants and delicious food. Totally recommended!

The experience in the resort overall was very nice. Service overall is at highest standard, staff very friendly. We had an amazing time with the entertainment team. Ricky, Victor and Paola were very professional, the best latin dancing i have ever experienced. Besides the great show offered every evening they were very friendly and made us feel very welcomed and taken care off. Definitely a recordation. You don't want to miss seeing Ricky in action! 😉

First of all I want to say that the staff are all lovely and friendly and they deal with any problems. However there is a few things  The beach unfortunately is full of seaweed and stones so you can’t really get in the sea water, the restaurants need to offer more of a variety on the menus , the pools could also do with a clean or filtered better. The rooms are comfortable although the floors are very slippery especially when wet it’s an accident waiting to happen. The hotel offers club cars which have been amazing although they could do with a few more for the size of the hotel.  We spent two fantastic weeks here overall

We went with family and enjoyed our time! Our third time going! Only minor hiccups. We’ll be going back again!  1. Our room safe defaulted twice and security has to come and “break into it”. 2. There was no hot water had cold water to take showers. 3. Our bed was broken causing the mattress and box spring to move side to side.

I'll start by saying I usually don't write reviews and I do not consider myself a person that is hard to please. That being said, I feel the need to try to help someone spending their hard earned money on a vacation from making the same mistake I did in booking this resort. The TL;DR is don't stay here. We ended up moving to another resort halfway through our trip.   We get there after a long day of travel, check in, and the first thing they do is try to get us to sign up for a 3 hour breakfast in order to try to sell us a timeshare. That was red flag number one. We finally make it to our room and are instantly hit with a musty smell and floors that don't feel clean, but the view is ok and we're ready to make the best of it. We grab drinks and go to the seafood restaurant for

For the price of the all inclusive, the food options were limited and not very tasty. Don't go here looking for steak. The bars close early usually by 12:45am they will stop making frozen drinks due to the blender being "broken". There is barely any water pressure in the rooms and you hardly ever get hot water.

All of the staff as well as the cleaning service were so respectful and sweet.The food was so delicious and drinks!  Such an amazing experience and will definitely will return! Thank you to all the staff!

Overall this resort is nice and the staff is very friendly.  However we had a problem with the plumbing in our room every single day requiring maintenance.  Very frustrating since we were staying the the Preferred Suites. Additionally the pillows were awful.  I am not sure we would return to this resort given our experience.  The fiesta night had an outdoor buffet and the food was terrible. Salads were left outside in the heat and flies everywhere.  It felt very unsanitary.

The food was great, the entertainment staff and service overall was wonderful.  My daughter and I enjoyed the spa. I loved stretching/yoga on the beach each morning. Victor, Ricky, Benito Mojito and Paola were amazing!

There wasn't any AC for 1 day of my 2 nights 3 day vacation.1400.00 trip for one person. Was there for a wedding. That happen on the day of the wedding. It was 100 degrees outside, so trying to get dress in your room when your sweating right after a shower.

We arrived to to the hotel June 1, 2023 hoping to have an amazing trip with an ocean view room. We get to our room which we notice is pretty hot, we lowered the air and continued with the day, when we get back at night the room is hotter than it was when we got there. We go to the lobby to see if we can get some help because we could not sleep in the heat. A  worker named Armando was there and was extremely rude the rest of the workers were basically laughing. They end up moving us room at around 10pm with a lower grade room. The next morning we went to find a manager and were being told no one was in to help us. We go back again around 4pm and thats when Angel the “manager” comes out saying the ac would be fixed soon but if we wanted to prevent moving we could just stay in the

I wouldn’t come back , place need to be updated, food was nasty, and the room was dirty sheets smelled so bad. Not the experience I was hoping for. The staff lied to us, not worth the money I spent…..

Very nice hotel  We stay 2 weeks there and it’s worth it  The entertainment team is awesome, special thanks to Ricky and Victor for they good vibes and the variety of the activities they offer !! Definitely recommend this place for fun and chill !!

We've been to a lot of hotels in the area, but we chose this one to get married at! Today we took a guacamole making class with Ricky and I have to say, it was one of the most fun experiences at the resort! We will be following up with Ricky for when we come back for our wedding. I highly recommend this class and would definitely do other activities run by Ricky again!

I don’t write Reviews unless it’s a bad experience, to start checking in was awful super slow issue after issue the room was great for a positive flip. the food was unbelievable bad the drinks where mediocre and the ground where ok very run down ready to be cleaned up and take over by a new company the staff was ok for the country you’re in pool chair are hard to find

Excellent staff, clean resort. They have activities for families in and out of the pool. They strive to make sure you have a best time there. Definitely worth the money and time to visit Dreams Tulum.

I had an amazing time with my trip to Dreams Tulum! All the staff here are incredibly kind and accommodating. The entertainment team, Victor, Ricky and Paulo, do an amazing job and are so interactive with the people staying here. There are lots of activities on a daily basis that range from pool activities, live music, karaoke, night markets, salsa dancing and more. Every activity was extremely entertaining, engaging and fun. We ate at every restaurant on the resort and the food did not disappoint and the service was great. I have no complaints about this resort and would recommend it to anyone.   Thank you to all the staff who made this an unforgettable trip!

Perfect location and beautiful people!  This is our second time visiting Dream Tulum and it is magical! We were married here in a Mayan ceremony 10 years ago and renewed our vows this time…such an amazing experience!

It is a beautiful resirt with lits of walking spaces and great eatery. The beds are comfortable and the spaces are always clean. The different themed restaurants bring daily variety.  Eliazar at the Boudroux restaurant was the warmest and amazing waiter. This place is defenitely on the return list.

We LOVED our stay! All of the employees were very friendly, giving a “hola” or “buenos noches” each time we passed. Everything was very clean. The housekeeping did a wonderful job tidying our room and not bothering us. We didn’t know when they managed to come, as we never saw them, but they always managed to clean while we were away.  Eleasar was an amazing waiter and Willy was such a friendly face in the preferred lounge. We were so appreciative of their hospitality!  The only constructive feedback we’d give is that the resort wasn’t very good about allergy-friendly options. We are gluten-sensitive and have celiac disease, so it would’ve been helpful if more options were provided. Some things we discovered were gluten free but they were not clearly labeled, so we didn’t know

All the members of the Dreams Tulum team were friendly and welcoming.  The entertainment helped gather everyone together and the crowd happened to be easygoing and fun during my stay. Lots of fun.  Paola, Benito Mojito, and all the bartenders contributed to our great experience. One moment of eye contact and me and my wife’s drinks were ready in no time!  Family oriented, but great for couples. Highly recommend !

Staff is friendly but the rest was sub-par.  First, we ate at the Mexican restaurant on our first evening after arriving. Food was marginal, the hostess was rude, and the choices were limited. Our room was in the Preferred area.  The pillows are terribly uncomfortable . The next morning we woke up and the toilet was plugged (not from anything we did).  Called front desk and was told they would be there in 10 minutes.  We decided to get coffee and come back. Still not done.  Called again.  Went to the pools and came back later, room not clean, toilet still plugged. Had to use the restrooms at the lobby area all day. Waited nearly 10 hours to get toilet plunged.  Woke up the next morning, same problem.  Plugged toilet. We were at the hotel for our daughter’s wedding and had events

Today is our first day here and I must say the hotel is lovely. It’s too bad the customer service isn’t.    Upon arrival we were greeted by the bellman who escorted us to the front desk. There the front desk agents didn’t say much to us and we had to ask when they would be checking us to which their response was we are checking guests out at this time. Mind you we stood there for about 10-15 mins just for acknowledgement which we had to ask for. We didn’t understand why they would just tell us that our room wasn’t ready or to have a seat until they could help us.   The restaurants are disorganized in how they handle the seating as well as get your food to you.    The extra mile was no where to be found as far as getting us checked in was concern   Hopefully this gets better

Currently here. The ac is not working, they looked at it earlier and now they are saying it is a full hotel problem. Room is roasting. Safe has broken each time we use it and we have to wait for someone each time we need to leave room: bring everything you need with you, tried to buy a beach ball for kids for pool $45 in the shop!!!!

The resort has the potential for a great stay, the food is definitely not a reason we would ever go back. The staff is extremely friendly. Not much to do in the way of nightlife. Drinks were good, didn’t skimp on the alcohol.

Not enough coathangers provided and far too little space to put clothes very disappointed with this and air conditioning would not cool down to set temperature and kept going up,never had one like this before

I have been to many resorts but never experienced such a bad experience. I want to point out few things before anyone falls for this resort. The food is just worse. The buffet offers same food every day and has no flavors. The workers make it so obvious that they do not want to be working there. Anytime we asked for help or questions, they just showed attitude. Even in the restaurants, they flat out just say we don’t have this or that and wont bother offering any alternatives. The room service has such small options to order from and there is at least an hour wait no matter what time you order. It felt like they did not want us to order. Even for check out, we had requested someone to pick up luggage from the room the night before but no one came. When we called the lobby, we

Dreams Tulum is an older property but is extremely beautiful. It has a certain charm that we loved. We stayed at several Dreams, Secrets, Breathless and Now resorts in the past and this one has the worst dining experience by far. The quantity of the menu items is about half the other sister resorts. The quality is mediocre. We didn't get dessert on 4 of the 7 nights because they ran out. The service is just okay. We had to get the staff's attention multiple times to get our coffee or water refilled. Never had to deal with this at the other resorts. Overall, we cannot really recommend this resort even though it is in a good location and is really beautiful.

I have been able to enjoy a lot of dreams now and secret resorts. But this one keeps getting more and more frustrating each day we have been here.  Wednesday the room smelled like sewage and cigarettes. Thursday they forgot to clean our room which they must have realized at 5 pm. So they came three times in an hour to offer towels. Friday lunch was a mess. Only one restaurant open.  Lines everywhere.  No food in the preferred club or the coco cafe.  And the buffet for whatever reason took a break.  And the app.  It’s not accurate.  Last evening said seaside grill open- heck it says that for all days  but it was closed. Today says multiple places open for lunch but it’s not accurate.    We are preferred club and I have no idea what is preferred when half the stuff isn’t open or

Rooms were supposedly updated, however, there is quite a bit of wear and tear, i.e. missing drawers, stains on floors, lamps coming out of the walls.  Aire conditioning was a HUGE negative for me.  75 degrees is unacceptable with no control on making it any cooler.  Restaurant service left a little to be desired.  Although we ate early, service was slow and waitstaff seemed uninterested.  Best service was beach side.  They ran around all day in the heat and never missed a beat!  I know this is out of the resort's control, but ocean was full of seaweed and nothing but sharp rocks.  Not great to swim in.

I had such an amazing experience! We love the service from all the Dream team! Eleazar was above and beyond on my Bday celebration! Thank you for a magical experience! We will be back next year! Highly recommend it!

I traveled with a big group and it was a bad experience. We upgraded to preferred and had to wait all day to get our rooms. Once we get a room our AC wasn't working. Staff was not helpful at all and rude.

I was impressed, mostly by the attention of everyone in the hotel. They are all super helpful, kind and everyone really focuses on making your experience flawless.   The second thing is the food, it has so many restaurants included, I couldn't try them all, but everything I tried was delicious. Specially during dinner, the food is gourmet quality, with different specials everyday.   I was genuinely surprised by the quality of the food, given that this is an all inclusive resort.   The hotel is a little outdated and needs an update, but every area and the rooms are very comfortable, clean so it doesn't make much of a difference.   The hotel is perfect for children.

The staff is excellent at this hotel. The food taste and quality was below our expectation for an all inclusive. If you are a foodie don't stay here. The location is great. Snacks and drinks were good and everyone is very friendly.

We travelled here with a family of 7 in June 2023  When getting to the hotel at 4am after over 15 hours of travelling with 3 children under 5 they informed us they did not have our booking.  We provided all  information, but that was not enough.  They told us that we would not be able to stay there until they had some sort of money.  So we had to hand over our debit card so that they could put a hold on the card until the travel company paid the hotel. They withdraw £1000 there and then!!!!   They would not refund this until they had been paid by the travel company.  Every day we spent over an hour in reception on the phone ringing out travel company trying to sort out a problem that the hotel should of been sorting themselves.  The very last day of our holiday, they confirmed

I'd question the 5 Star rating for this resort, specifically the inconsistent quality of the rooms, we had to move 4 times.  Food is average, especially for Vegetarians and Vegans.  What I would say is the entertainment team are excellent, they go out of their way to keep you entertained and engaged, so much fun. Victor, Ricky and Paula are a fantastic trio, very friendly and funny, also professional. We love these guys.  This made our holiday , hence the reason for 5 rating,  all for the entertainment.

Not sure whose fault it was, bookings or Dreams, but I was charged an extra $1500 upon arrival.  Management did not offer even a cup of coffee to try and appease the situation.  Very disappointed.  Room also smelled like mold and room service took over an hour.

We had wonderful holidays in the hotel. As a family with 3 children, the children's clubs are important to us. We found a wonderful club in the hotel that took great care of our children. Our children had a great time and we would like to give a special mention to Laura, the childcare worker who took care of our children in an unforgettable way. Our children still rave about her to this day. We can recommend her to all parents at any time. And we are very grateful to her for this time.

Not the greatest! This property needs renovation and an exterminators, especially the mattresses that are well overdue for a replacement. I wouldn’t get too excited after looking at pictures, which can very misleading!

We stayed at your hotel for 2 weeks from 22nd June 2023 we had an okay time but weren’t very happy with quite a few thing.   We weren’t that impressed with the restaurants I can almost guarantee that at-least one or more restaurants were shut each night. Which then made the other restaurants super busy with a long waiting time to eat. We were even turned away from one restaurant portafios as there were too many family’s in the queue ahead of us. There was one restaurant the seaside grill we almost didn’t get into at-all but managed on one of our last nights to get in. We would have liked to eat there more offered but only got into once as it was always shut due to weddings. The Asian restaurant where they cook in front  of you was always full book never managed to eat there

The service was exceptional. Everyone was very kind and accommodating. Armando at Seaside Grill went above and beyond to bring us drinks and make sure we were taken care of. My daughter loved going to the kids club and enjoyed Lauren, Patricia, Venessa, Leslie and Mariela. They treated her like family, and she kept wanting to spend time there with swimming, arts and crafts, and video games. The gym was very clean with a lot of machines and free weights. Only complaint would be the amount of mosquitoes, but they did fumigate our room. It’s in the middle of the jungle, so that was expected. Pharmacy has creams and sprays for them. We loved Dreams Tulum!
